reviews.content:
Well made quality product that is perfect for me. Peleton-bike ease of use for the serious cyclist - always ready, just jump on and go. Emulates my road bike gearing (DI2) but without drive train wear and damage to that bike. Can stand up in confidence and the tilt feature is great.
I'm a Long time Sufferlandrian, I moved from TrainerRoad for the yoga and strength training to compliment my overall fitness and core strength. Wahoo has improved the Sufferland product and everything works.

reviews.content:
Key points: 1) easy order process 2) less than 2 weeks from order to delivery 3) packaged perfectly and simple to unpack and assemble 4) instructions through application are very well written with illustrations to further confidence in set up

After set up, connecting to Zwift and making custom adjustments is straight-forward. 

The bike is sturdy and the wheel decibel level remains at a low hum (you can hear any music over it or carry on a phone conversation without interruption).

Highly recommend pedal upgrades for use with bike shoes - this is the real experience and don't settle for anything else.

I am 5 rides in right now and each one has been more enjoyable than the previous as I become more familiar with the bike - give it time... just like anything else... and you'll be smiling.
reviews.title: A finely made smart bike that I am enjoying

I am using the bike for Zwift with an Apple TV and Apple watch setup. The initial setup required some googling, but now everything is connected and feeds the data to each other. So from connectedness perspective the bike is working as expected.
As for the build quality, there are more qualified people than me who wrote articles about the bike, but I can only confirm that the simulation feeling is really great.
The only downside for me is that when you are pedaling standing (i.e. not in the saddle) then the feeling is somewhat strange compared to a regular indoor bike.

reviews.title: When all you ever knew was a trainer

reviews.content:
Pros: the build set up is very quick, a couple of bolts through the support legs and figure out your bike fit from your current road bike. Then plug it in. I have mine set up on a mat on carpet and it’s very stable. I weigh 150lbs 5’11”. There is no spin down or calibration needed so that was fantastic compared to the KICKR. The bike fit adjustments are simple and straightforward with measurement markers to remember your fit if anyone else wants to ride. Once riding, the ride is very smooth. The ERG mode in workouts is amazing. Power change is rapid and holds the power steady within 1-2 watts always. It sounds a bit like an electric vehicle, almost silent. Big difference from the chain grinding days with the KICKR. This bike works wonderfully with all Wahoo apps and products. I will admit, I don’t use Zwift as I’m training for CX and XC racing and Zwift is too glitchy as a 3rd party app. I replaced the seat with my own so I can’t comment on the comfort level there. 

Cons: there aren’t many really. My biggest, and it’s mostly a personal preference, is the cockpit/handlebars. I prefer a thicker bar that is a little larger. There are also so many different areas that can be gear shifters that I find myself accidentally pushing these buttons while riding. I haven’t figured out how to lock some of them out so that it’s just shifting with the brakes below the hoods which is what I prefer from my Di2 shifting. It also doesn’t ride as smooth in low cadence/high power drills. It gets a little bumpy but that’s at a cadence of 50-60 which I don’t do much. 

Overall very happy with the purchase and would do it again for the flawless shifting and silent ride quality. Great job Wahoo.
reviews.title: Wahoo Bike

reviews.content: The bike has been fantastic. Assembly was a breeze. Connecting it to Zwift and Systm was equally as easy. It’s construction is solid and stable. I’m around 200 pounds and it provides a great platform to put down watts. The ride feel on Zwift is very realistic, I just wish that elevation was integrated more into Systm workouts. I have two complaints. The seat post is very hard to get to stay in place (seat post paste is a necessity), and the handle bars will not stay perfectly centered. They turn ever so slightly when I clamp them in place. You may not notice it since it is slight, but it does happen. Overall, I highly recommend the bike if you can deal with the price.
reviews.title: Love my kickr bike

reviews.content:
Full disclosure, I have never had a smart trainer although I've had a dumb trainer. For the last few years, I have used a very cheap spin bike with power meter pedals to Zwift and ride. So, relatively, the Kickr Bike is a dream ride. 

Wahoo's installation and configuration guidance were amazing although I struggled a little to get the bike configured. I used the Wahoo app's ability to take a picture of my road bike in order to get my measurements, which at first wasn't working likely due to an unknown user error but eventually, I figured it out and the measurements felt correct. I did struggle and frankly perhaps am still struggling to understand if I've mapped the right settings to the Kickr bike that mimic my road bike. The shifting when I'm riding the Kickr doesn't seem to be the same shifting as when I'm riding my road bike. I wish this were easier to understand with a feature to perhaps select my bike/component from a dropdown list to ensure it matches expectations. 

I thought that it's a little weird to unplug the bike when turning it off but okay. When beginning a ride, the bike will make noise but quiets down to a small whir after a few moments of getting going. 

I struggled at first to understand the modes (i.e., ERG vs Level) and what symbols on the bike's display meant (closed lock versus open lock). Now it's easy to remember. The point is that there was some learning curve to understand the features from the perspective of someone using a new smart trainer/bike for the first time. 

The cost is steep but the Kickr bike keeps me going and definitely feels more like a bike than my last setup. Time will tell how I really feel but after a few weeks, I am loving it.
reviews.title: Kickr Bike Forever

cost.sentence: The cost is steep but the Kickr bike keeps me going and definitely feels more like a bike than my last setup.

Obviously, since I just got it, I can't speak to its durability. But if you were afraid to get one of the certified reconditioned units, don't be (when one becomes available). It'll work just as well as a new bike.

reviews.content:
My Wahoo Kickr is only a week old and so far I am very impressed. Assembly & setup were quick & simple (but if you are not strong, have a helper). Instructions were easy to follow.

I use it with the Zwift App and they interface easily & work well together. 

It seems sturdy & well-built, so I hope it will last a long time. But since it is new, I can't say for sure that it will.

The only 2 things I could suggest to improve the Kickr are that the Top Tube of the bike (in its lowest position) is too high for anyone with an inseam less than about 30-31 inches and I wish I had the option to get mine with mountain bike handlebars and trigger shifters.
reviews.title: Definitely Recommended

reviews.content:
I have been using a Wahoo Kickr trainer for two years now and decided to go all out and get Kickr Bike. The difference is Night and Day. The Kickr turbo trainer was great but the Kickr Bike is solid, well built and so responsive. I have only had it for two weeks now but I have used it everyday and upped my train considerably. I use it with Zwift and have beaten all my times on every course and increased my FTP. 
I l;ove this bike which is a joy to ride :-)
reviews.title: Go for it
